Description: Limestone ostracon, worn, with remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink on one side and a black-painted cross-with-dots on the other.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.147)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.99)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82861) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82861)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I App:24 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 150 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
